Name: Oscar's Hot Night Out
Description:
Oscar's Hot Night Out is an adult party game based around crafting ingenious names for imaginative "adventures." It's played with three types of cards: Tops, Bottoms and Adventures. All players will have four Tops and four Bottoms; combining one each of these cards creates a description or phrase that we call a "Name". Every round, a Judge will draw and read an Adventure -- a description of a fanciful and often naughty act -- out loud to the players. The other players each attempt to create a name for the Adventure from the cards in their hand and submitting it secretly. The Judge reads the submissions out loud and chooses the best name to win the round; its owner becomes the Judge for the next round. The game continues until a player has accumulated a number of wins  based on the total number of players, or everyone has laughed enough.

Oscar's Hot Night Out is a different kind of adult party game. Are there naughty words? Yes, most certainly. Adult Situations? Absolutely! But, Oscar's Hot Night Out is a raunchy game designed  for everyone to enjoy -- whatever your preference or background, you're welcome at this table (as long as you can handle the occasional dirty word...) Oscar's Hot Night Out is a sex positive party game that celebrates what two (or more) consenting adults can get up to without condemnation or judgement. The game can be played by all genders and creeds. Oscar's Hot Night Out is not about creating uncomfortable shock humor or belittling other sexes and sexuality; it is fundamentally about the delight everyone gets from devilishly naughty turns of phrase and the fanciful acts they describe.

Name: Jackal Archipelago: Ben Gunn's Island
Description: Jackal Archipelago: Ben Gunn's Island is a new island that supplements the four islands included in the Jackal: Archipelago base game, allowing for larger islands to be created. Unique tiles of this set include the meeting with Ben Gunn and Spy Glass Hill.

Name: Jackal Archipelago: Island of Thousands Caves
Description: Jackal Archipelago: Island of Thousands Caves is a new island that supplements the four islands included in the Jackal: Archipelago base game, allowing for larger islands to be created. Unique tiles of this set include caves and the wheelbarrow.

Name: Bushido: Temo
Description:
Temo fled first from the brutal enslavement of the Ito then from the worker camps of the Silvermoon. A resourceful seaman who holds and practises with great honour the knowledge of the jungle plants passed down through generations. It is these exotic combinations that he uses to dose his distinct blowpipe, the effects of the those darted vary from panic to rage dependant on the dart used.
—description from the publisher

Name: Are You a Human?
Description:
The year is 2025, and it's been a long time since the robots have taken over the Earth. Now it's time to pass the final test to prove that you have nothing but oil in your veins and no trace of humanity left, and there's no better way to do this than to demonstrate your perfect memory!

Your goal in Are You a Human? is to guess the three characteristics of the cards. Guess card features and score points in a way that boosts player interaction, forces you to assess the risks, and makes everyone involved in the exciting process. Pass the captcha of the nasty robots!

Name: Bushido: Ran Fujiwaro
Description:
A warrior sister of the Fujiwaro, Ran has betrayed her sisters to join with Mari Jung for reasons unknown. A blur on the battlefield, her sai finding cracks in armour and hide alike to cripple foes with a whirlwind of keenly placed attacks. 
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Sho
Description:
From the Jwar to the Golden Sands across the Barren Sea, no more able a deckhand can be found. His body a net of tight knotted muscle, his mind a map of the sea.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Taru
Description:
A brave and able seaman, he uses his net as a barrier to defend against missiles directed at him and also to divert their force against the attacker. Nimble and quick footed Taru is a great soldier for the Jung.
—description from the publisher

Name: Fixienomics
Description:
In Fixienomics, you play as one of the Fixies, creating unusual inventions and trying to eliminate accidents.

Each round, the Fixies bid against each other using Details to create an invention in one of the sectors. From time to time, there are accidents that need to be eliminated, and as with the inventions, the Fixies compete to see which one of them will be able to fix the accident.

Name: Bushido: Mari Jung
Description:
Queen of Waves, Lady of the Sea, the Third Storm are all and yet just a few of her names. Her eyes as deep as the ocean, her temper as terrible as a storm, as beautiful and inspiring to her crew as she is fear and reviled by her enemies. Her mere presence in the heat of battle staying her shipmates nerves, her tongue a weapon with which to strike at the honor of her opponents. For their captain her men would gladly make the ultimate sacrifice.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Lua, Buto Pirate
Description:
It seems that the temptation of riches and sake are not the only things that can lead the Buto to leave their tribe. Lua a fine specimen of the Buto people has long since left the island of his birth, driven to satisfy a deep and lasting wanderlust the Jung are his new people. Much like many of those who crew the Jung ships he adds somethings few others can offer. His great axe felling foes or masts alike. He still has a few tricks up his sleeve learnt from his youth in the crowded streets of Jima to surprise though.  
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Kohanin
Description:
A life on the waves makes you hard, bodies muscled and lean, the sway of the ocean becomes as natural as sitting under a tree. This is the life of Kohanin, their lives before swearing loyalty to the captain forgotten. Their crimes washed away as debris from a beach at high tide. More comfortable on deck than land, they are capable sailors and fighters, turning their weapons of labour into deadly instruments of battle in an instant.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Arata
Description:
The fury of the Chrome Sea, the shark is the apex predator beneath the waves and Arata is just as frightening above water. Dazzlingly fast, driven wild by the smell of blood, he is a pure monster when unleashed. Whether savaging startled enemies with a maw of razor sharp teeth, or bowling then over with tremendous force he is a formidable warrior. Like all those changed by the great Kami Sumiyoshi Sanjin, little is left of the man he once was but this does not matter in times of war.
—description from the publisher

Name: Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Pharaos Gruft – Four Game Boards
Description: As you might guess from the title, Das Labyrinth des Pharao: Four Game Boards consists of four new game boards for use with the Das Labyrinth des Pharao base game.

Name: Secret Agent 007: The Game of International Spies
Description:
ΜυστικÏŒς ΠρÎ¬κτωρ 007: Το παιχνÎ¯δι των διεθνÏŽν κατασκÏŒπων ("Secret Agent 007: The Game of International Spies") is an old greek board game from the 60's, whose main theme is, the famous secret agent James Bond.

Your goal is to find and gather secret files, which are hidden in embassies. The winner is the player, who has most of the files in the end of the game. The game involves dice roll to move.

Name: Dust 1947: Battle for Zverograd
Description:
The year is 1947, and World War II is far from over! Thanks to the discovery of a crashed ship from outer space, Germany acquired access to advanced technology. New armament and VK-propelled walkers lumber on the battlefield. Discover a world in which soldiers use conventional rifles next to lasers and jet packs.

Dust 1947 is a hybrid of board and miniature games. Using high quality plastic figurines, players fight over a special mat divided into squares. Checking line of sight, movement, or weapon ranges is easy and intuitive thanks to light and clear rules. On the other hand the game offers a great tactical depth and wide range of possibilities when you create your fighting force.

Dust 1947: Battle for Zverograd is a two-player starter set for Dust 1947 that also serves as a standalone game.

Name: Claims of Gold
Description:
The race is on! Ole prospector Gus has kicked the bucket—God rest his soul. His last will and testament states that the deed to his gold-rich land goes to the first miner to claim 30 ounces from the dirt. Payment is due in seven days.

Claims of Gold plays over seven rounds with mechanics that combine worker placement and press your luck. Each turn, players place miner meeples out on the board to take different actions like visiting the workshop, mining the land, or cleaning out dirt to find gold. Taking an action first gives the best benefit, so players are met with challenging decisions on how to efficiently collect gold while trying to foil the efforts of other miners.

Press-your-luck comes into play as players clean out buckets of dirt from their operation to find gold. Bedrock is more rich with gold than regular Dirt, but watch out—it also contains more rocks. If a player reveals two rocks when cleaning out, then a piece of equipment they have acquired from the shop breaks.

Will you be the miner that claims it all?

Name: Eldritch Horror: Masks of Nyarlathotep
Description:
Eldritch Horror: Masks of Nyarlathotep is an expansion for Eldritch Horror, a cooperative board game for one to eight players in which intrepid investigators must traverse the globe in an attempt to thwart the cataclysmic rise of an otherworldly Ancient One. Strange cults are gathering strength in remote corners and bustling cities all over the world. Though they seem to worship different gods, the investigators have found a thread that runs throughout all of the cultists’ horrific rites.

In Masks of Nyarlathotep, each of these sects pursues the awakening of an aspect of the same horrific creature: Nyarlathotep. This being is known as the Messenger of the Outer Gods, and he is the only Ancient One that still actively walks among humanity. The investigators must work to stop the cults springing up to serve his many guises, or Nyarlathotep will gain enough strength to open the Ultimate Gate, ushering in an unthinkable doom. Strike down these cults in new Adventures, explore ancient mysteries among new Mystic Ruins, and destroy the monstrous followers of Nyarlathotep. New to this expansion, Personal Stories unique to each character add stakes to the actions undertaken by each investigator, and a Campaign mode adds a fresh challenge and enriches the narrative of the investigators’ struggles to stop the many cults worshipping the multitude of faces worn by one dread being in Eldritch Horror: Masks of Nyarlathotep!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Beard Wars: The Card Game
Description:
Beard Wars is a game played with 2 or 4 players. 
The object of Beard Wars is to collect as many of your opponents Beard Cards before the deck runs out. Some of the cards contain abilities to help you carry out this objective. Read them carefully.

Setup:
Each player has their own deck. There will be a draw pile, discard pile, and trophy pile.

Draw Pile: This is your main deck of cards. At the beginning of each turn, you draw until you have 7 cards in your hand.

Discard Pile: This is where your used cards go. Including Instant Plays and your own used Beard Cards.

Trophy Pile: When you win a card from your opponent, place it here so you can count them up at the end.

—description from the designer

Name: Shocktato
Description:
Shocktato: the Shocking Potato Game. Pass the Shocktato around the group, but don't be left holding the Shocktato at the end!

Move the Game Mode Selector Switch to the position that says Extreme. This mode is for true Shocktato players. This mode got its name because it has no music, just a surprise buzzer and emits a shock. Now press the start button. In Extreme Mode, it will beep to let you know it is active but will play no music. Begin passing the Shocktato around the circle. Be quick though, when the buzzer sounds, the shock begins. The player who is left holding the Shocktato when it shocks must leave the game. The last player in the circle is the winner.

Move the Game Mode Selector Switch to the position that says Normal. Now press the start button. In Normal Mode, you will hear music begin to play. Begin passing the Shocktato around the circle. Be quick though, when the music stops, Shocktato emits a shock. The player who is left holding the Shocktato when it shocks must leave the game. The last player in the circle is the winner.

Move the Game Mode Selector Switch to the position that says Lame. This mode is for the weak at heart. This mode got its name because it does not shock. Now press the start button. In Lame Mode, you will hear music begin to play. Begin passing the Shocktato around the circle. Be quick though, when the music stops, the Shocktato makes a buzzing sound. The player who is left holding the Shocktato at the buzzer must leave the game. The last player in the circle is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wild West Exodus: Rules & Gubbins Set
Description:
Wild West Exodus is a dynamic, fast-paced semi-skirmish game pitting a cast of brutal characters against each other in a world very much like our own, but twisted by the forces of deepest evil. Characters in Wild West Exodus are balanced upon the edge of a knife, a horrible death waiting patiently on either side. They move swiftly across the table, they fight with frightening speed and lethal skill, and they die abruptly.

An advanced D10 system is coupled with an innovative Influence mechanic to simulate the powers of the Dark Council upon their unwitting pawns. Players must choose how they will gamble with the power of their patrons: spread the Influence throughout a turn, hoping to ease destiny onto a brighter path, or hold the influence, to be entirely cast upon one roll of the dice?

Wild West Exodus is a 35mm steampunk miniatures game set in the Wild West of America and is an action packed game of gunslingers, lawmen, outlaws, mad scientists, aliens and more!

This smart boxed set includes a rulebook, tokens, templates, dice and the Action and Adventure card decks. It is an ideal accompaniment to any Posse set and is perfect for giving you all the accessories and the rules so you can get playing straight away.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wild West Exodus: Gunfight at Red Oak
Description:
A chance encounter in the town of Red Oak between the notorious Outlaw Jessie James and the grim Lawman Wyatt Earp erupts into open conflict. This easy introductory set includes ten multi-part plastic miniatures, a rulebook, tokens, templates, dice and the Action and Adventure card decks. An ideal starting point to get you playing Wild West Exodus.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sagrada: Promo 4 – BoardGameGeek Window Pattern Card
Description: A window pattern card for Sagrada that features a level 3 and 6 pattern on opposing sides.
Families: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

Name: Mob Mentality
Description:
"An epic party game designed by adults for adults"

"It will get dirty and you're gonna love it!"

OBJECT OF THE GAME

You want to understand and think like the group you're playing with.

Questions are asked to the party group and the answers will either be what the majority decides or the actual census of the group. Answer correctly to score points and win.  Our game is made for kick ass adults who like to party and rule the mob!

For Mob Rules and Mob Blank cards: You do not necessarily answer a question with what you think the answer is but what you think the majority of the group will answer. You want to have a mob mentality. If you guess an answer that is in the majority, you score points.

Mob Census cards: You want to guess the total number of people in the group who have done what the card asks. You want to guess the correct mob census.

The game starts by nominating one person in the group to be an all-time Question Master. The Question Master is tasked with reading all questions and controlling the tempo and tone of the game. If people are talking and having fun, slow the game down and enjoy the moment!

The game is played through three rounds. Whoever scores the most points at the end of the game has the ultimate mob mentality and wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sunday School Answers
Description:
In the same tradition of Apples to Apples and Cards Against Humanity there is a card game for the church generation. If you are a fan of satire, hyperbole, church cultural or making fun of things that take themselves too seriously you will find this game hilarious.

It's easy! 3-5 players can play at one time. One of them puts down a dilemma/question card and the other players have to answer it with their most sassy answer. The judge picks the funniest answer and everyone laughs.

This game is written and created by a Jesus loving educational minister who wondered why his church friends couldn't have more irreverent fun at church culture.

—description from the designer

Name: Heroes & Gods: The Master of Dreams
Description:
Heroes & Gods is a fantasy game based on PvPvE mechanics which opens the door for strategic partnerships during the gameplay, creating unexpected situations where interaction between players is both key and strategy. The player takes control of a Hero belonging to one of the four major races (Basharii, Elysar, Takan or Aedolas) as the adventure commences.

High replay value and custom builds : The entire game is built on concepts such as freedom of choice, versatility while strategizing and social interaction. You build your Hero the way it suits you best. Use custom skills, cast one-of-a-kind magic spells, arm yourself with ancient or legendary weapons and armors, use unique magical potions or forgotten scrolls, take companions to help you defeat your foes. The competitive spirit is re-triggered each time you start a new Heroes and Gods session as the Heroes may be different for your will choose a different strategy in accordance to the gameplay that is unique with each game start. Each time you start there will be a new path to follow, a new strategy to apply, a new hero that you can build.

Social component and diplomacy : Demand actions from other players, ask for items or simply take control of the game and dictate moves if you get yourself into the power position, but be careful how you do it... Your reputation is going to make you or break you! Aside from the basic set of rules, the game gives you the freedom to decide what to do, who to attack, what loot you want to take for yourself, which rewards you want to share with your allies, who is going to fight the epic monsters at your side and more. Whether you want to attack a legendary creature, start an in-game quest, trade or fight for map shards to solve Aenigmas you will almost always need allies. Diplomacy plays a key role in the development of the game.

URGH NASIR trader and free trade : The game is designed to offer as much freedom as possible and great rewards to those who emerge victorious from battles. Each defeated monster can be captured. The soul dealer in Urgh will revive companions and sell you weapons, armors, potions, spells quests and upgrade your items and skills. Any item can be freely traded between players. Each player can initiate a trade session before starting their turn. In addition to this each 7th turn brings with it an auction market which contains unique artifacts.

During the game, the Heroes will go up against unique monsters, solve Aenigmas to reach epic locations guarded by legendary keepers, complete quests to receive unique items, call upon forgotten Gods asking for their favors in battle, explore unique sites filled with otherworldly creatures. As the game evolves the Heroes will improve their backpacks with spell scrolls, potions, skills, weapons and armors with unique abilities while fighting all together, in separate teams or each for his own. At the end, the surviving Heroes will battle once more and they will have to defeat Darva, the keeper of the souls in order to ascend and become Gods themselves.

The game offers an unlimited number of strategies that you can apply in your gameplay. It can be played co-op until the end or you could focus on eliminating your opponents one by one.

Name: Yeiri-Ri
Description:
Yeiri-Ri has been dedicated to the indigenous people of wixarika, or Huichol, of Mexico, taking as a board his craft called "eye of God", it is an abstract game with simple rules.

Each player chooses one of the 5 colors in play, except the black color, which will be common for all, of the black each player retires a single chip, and so will be able to move his chips to the empty spaces, moving them by jumping two continuous tiles and linked by lines to fall into the next empty space, regardless of the direction, this action can be done using black, but when a player uses one of these chips, the next can not move the same black chip, and will have to wait that a turn passes to be able to move it again, if a black chip leaves the green space, it will not be able to return to it, the purpose is to unite the three tiles of the same color make a triangle joined by lines and that there are no adjoining spaces between them , the person who does it first, wins the game.

The game can be played between 4 people, or between two people.

—description from the designer

Name: Heroes of History: Iron Phalanx vs. Dragonboat Raiders
Description:
In Heroes of History, you are the general and Gods and Kings are awaiting your orders. Give Thor Mjolnir and hammer away at King Leonidas and his Spartan Warriors making a last stand for Greeece. Or, turn the tables with Odysseus wielding Artemis's Bow and feed Viking kings to the Minotaur. Make the right moves, and be remembered for all time. Make the wrong moves, and be lost to the ages!

This is an expansion set for the original Heroes of History card game, featuring Midnight Riders (Revolutionary War) and Echoes of the Plains (Civil War). You do NOT need the first set to play the second set. They can be played together or separately.

2 players minimum; supports up to 4. The object is to reduce your opponent's State Points from 50 to 0. Draw cards from your deck, play Combatants like Thor, the Argonauts, Erik Bloodaxe, and Odysseus to the Trench and power them up with Weapon cards, including Artemis's Bow and Mjolnir. Play Supply cards to change the game situation. Zeus's Thunderbolt smites your opponent's entire War Zone, or use Danegeld to steal their State Points! Battlefields give bonuses to your side: will you battle in Valhalla or Troy?

This is a fully stand-alone game, but components can be combined with the original Heroes of History for a completely unique experience. Want Loki to shoot a Gatling gun? YOU can make it happen!

—description from the publisher

Name: Venture the Fog: Hydra
Description:
A board game designed to be a suspenseful adventure of exploration, strategy, and gambling where you are immersed in epic battles.

Action Battle System
Our interactive Battle System brings you directly into the fight itself, where the dice represent real-time actions your hero is performing

Our D8 custom Battle Dice include the following die faces: Attack (x2), Defend (x2), Roll, Jump, Slide, Wild.

Mist Monsters
As your Hero embarks on their journey, they will encounter monsters from the Mist (included in the core game).

Fog Monsters
Once your Hero is strong enough, they can begin Venturing the Fog. Lurking there are fiercer, more vile monsters (included in the extended game).

Gambling
Stay constantly engaged, wagering currency while other players battle monsters. Gamble correctly and use the newfound currency to your advantage.

Exploration
The expansive swamp is different each time you play. Venture deep into the unknown, carving you own path to collect treasures and defeat monsters along the way.

Gearing Up
Defeat monster and loot them for better armor and weapons. Be rewarded with additional loot by risking more challenging fights along the way.

—description from the publisher

Name: X-Statix
Description:
A card game for 2-3 players in which each player recruits a team of mutants for hire that use their powers and savvy marketing to achieve celebrity status and all the glory and riches they can get.

Players share a common deck comprising cards of four types: Heroes, Marketing, Missions and Powers.  Players share a common set of money tokens (MT) and fame tokens (FT)

Players take turns with each turn comprising 7 Phases:


     Opportunity Phase: Draw 1 card and put it in your hand. You may draw extra cards, but first for each you must pay 1D6 MT or pass.  If you pass, you may draw no more cards. 
     Recruitment Phase: You may put mutants (heroes) from your hand into play. To recruit a mutant you must first pay 1D6 MT.  If you choose not to, recruitment phase ends.  When you recruit a mutant, place his/her card face up in front of you and place 1 FT on it. 
     Publicity Phase: You may attach marketing cards to your heroes. To attach a marketing card you must first pay 1D6 MT.  If you choose not to the publicity phase ends.  A mutant may not have more marketing cards attached than he or she has FT. 
     Mission Phase: You may play 1 mission card from your hand. To go on the mission, you must have at least 1D6 heroes. If you do not, skip the rest of this phase. Roll 1D6. This is the Carnage roll. For each point of carnage, discard one power card from your hand. For each point of carnage not negated by a power card, kill off 1 random Hero of your Team. Gain 1D6 MT for each killed hero. If you have any surviving heroes roll 1D6. Add the number of survivors. This is the success roll. If the success roll is higher than the carnage roll, the mission is a success and you gain 2D6 MT.  You may discard power cards to add 1 to the success roll for each card discarded. All tokens and cards attached to a killed hero are discarded/lost with him. 
     Fame Phase: Each of your Heroes that survived a mission last phase gains a FT. 
     Fortune Phase: Gain 1 MT for each FT and marketing card you have in play. 
     End Phase: Max hand size is 5 cards.  Discard excess cards. 


The game ends when a player goes to start his turn, and there are no cards left in the deck. The player with the most MT at the end of the game wins.

Name: Xenophon and the Ten Thousand
Description:
A board game for 1-4+ players in which each player is a unique incarnation of Xenophon and the Ten Thousand. The 10,000 are Greek mercenaries who have come to fight for Cyrus, the younger brother of the Persian King Artaxerxes. Cyrus is killed in battle against the King leaving the Greeks abandoned, deep in hostile territory. The Greeks begin a long march northward to the Black Sea and Greek territory. The player whose pawn reaches the sea first and with the most men is the winner.

There are 2 Tracks: 

     The Distance Track. This track has 60 numbered spaces. The first space is that of Cunaxa where Cyrus was killed. The last space is the Coastal Greek Colony of Trapezus. Each player has his own uniquely coloured pawn which he moves along 


the distance Track. Each space represents about 10 Miles.

The Time Track

     This track has 60 numbered spaces. A single neutral pawn is moved a single space after all players have completed a single turn. When a player reaches the sea he should take his coloured pawn from the distance track and place it on the time track on the current space to mark how long his journey took.  Each space represents about 2 days. 


Each player starts with 10,000 men. Men are lost during the journey due to fighting, exposure, starvation, and desertion. Paper and pencil to keep track of your manpower total.

Each Food Token represents 1 days supply worth of food for the Army. Lack of Food Tokens will result in accumulation of Starvation Tokens. Mutiny Tokens represent dissent and despondency amongst the ranks. Anger Tokens represent the accumulation of barbarian forces arrayed against you.

Players share an action deck. Most cards will increase or reduce the value of a target die-roll. Most improve your rolls. Others will be to the detriment of your opponent.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 16 Phases: 

     Draw Phase - The current player draws 3 cards. 
     Route Phase - Roll against the Route Table.  The result will generate modifiers for one or more of the forage, travel and battle rolls. 
     Weather Phase – Roll against the Weather Table. The weather conditions will generate modifiers for the forage and travel rolls
     Satrap Phase – Roll against the Satrap table to determine whether you encounter a Satrap.
     Negotiations Phase - If you encountered a Satrap this turn make a negotiation roll. This will result in gaining Anger or Food tokens.
     Attack Phase - Make an Attack Roll. If your result is equal to or less than the number of AT you have, you are attacked by Barbarians. 
     Battle Phase - If you are attacked by Barbarians remove 1 Anger Token and make a battle roll to determine the number of casualties.
     Exposure Phase - If the weather was harsh this turn make an exposure roll and lose men accordingly.
     Forage Phase - You may choose not to forage, if so skip this turn. Otherwise make a roll against the forage table to gain a combination of food and anger tokens
     Consumption Phase - If you currently have a food token, discard all your starvation tokens. Discard 1 food token. If you have no food tokens to lose gain 1 starvation token. 
     Starvation Phase - If you have Starvation Tokens make a roll to determine the number of men lost.
     Morale Phase – Roll on morale table to determine whether you gain a mutiny token.
     Rally Phase - If you have mutiny tokens make a rally roll to see whether you can remove any of them.
     Desertion Phase - If you have mutiny tokens make a desertion roll to see whether any men desert. 
     Travel Phase - Make a travel roll to determine how far your pawn advances on the distance map. This roll will be modified by weather and route markers and other activities undertaken during the turn.
     End Phase - Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards. 


The game ends when all players have finally reached the last space on the Distance Track. Players then calculate their scores: 
Player Score = (Remaining men) divided by (number of turns to reach the sea)
Families: History: Greek & Persian conflicts of the 4th century BC

Name: Houkago Nana-fushigi
Description:
Houkago Nana-fushigi (æ”¾èª²å¾Œï¼—ä¸æ€è­° or „After School Seven Wonders”) is another horror-themed card game by Oishii Tanishi.

There is a rumour among the students called the „Seven Wonders”. Was your behaviour bad at the end of the semester? You have been chosen for an interesting cleaning duty: „All assigned members shall be spirited away” or „You shall be taken by the strangeness of the Seven Wonders”, and so on. Will you be able to execute your task? If you sneak away in the middle of it, it will be already too late, and you will become trapped in the school building!

Name: Sea Battle
Description:
A spinner driven war themed game where players move their ships down a track from the US Naval base to an enemy battleship and back.

For up to four players.

This game started as one game in a "Games of Adventure" 4 game set. The set included:

     Air Race around the World
     Jeep Patrol
     Rocket race to Saturn
     Sea Battle

Name: Oklahoma Sixer
Description:
6ãƒ©ãƒ›ãƒžãƒŸã‚­ã‚µãƒ¼ (Oklahoma Sixer) is a card game in which players are shamans who, at a festival held on one day each year, summon elemental spirits for a dance.

Each player chooses one of two actions each turn: play (from a hand of cards) a dance partner to his or her lead spirit, or play a card to one of two rows at the center of the table.

If the two rightmost cards in either card row in the center add up to six and are capped with a zero, players swap dance partners. This sometimes eliminates players' lead spirits as combinations of some elements (such as fire and water) are volatile. If either row has a total of six cards, a scoring occurs. The player with the highest combination of lead spirit and dance partner chooses all cards of one color from the row that caused the scoring. The player with the second highest combination follows, and so on. Cards taken from the row are set aside to score at the end of the game.

The game ends at some point after the stock deck runs out of cards for a second time. Players then score the cards that they have collected over the course of the game. Each card is worth one point, but bonuses are awarded according to the number of score cards of the same rank that each player has. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Aventuria: Tears of Fire
Description:
After a difficult ascent the heroes had at last reached the cave, which, according to legend, was home to an invincible monster and its immeasurable riches. The heroes believed the huge dark grotto in the mountain flank to be uninhabited, when three mighty heads rose from the darkness and a deep rumbling shook their limbs...

Tears of Fire is a monster expansion for Aventuria - The Adventure Card Game, in which the heroes are dealing with a three-headed dragon! In duel mode the dragon is controlled by a player, while in adventure mode the heroes can play the adventure “Tears of Fire201D and face the Giant Wyvern together. Through a selection of six different heads and four age levels the fight against the dragon remains challenging and varied over many games.

German original Version:
Endlich hatten die Helden nach mühsamem Aufstieg die Höhle erreicht, in der einer Legende nach ein unbezwingbares Ungetüm hausen und unermessliche Reichtümer horten sollte. Gerade glaubten die Helden, die riesige dunkle Grotte der Bergflanke sei unbewohnt, als sich drei gewaltige Köpfe aus der Finsternis erhoben und ihnen ein tiefes Grollen in die Glieder fuhr …
 Feuertränen ist eine Monstererweiterung für Aventuria - Das Abenteuerkartenspiel, bei der es die Helden mit einem leibhaftigen dreiköpfigen Drachen zu tun bekommen! Im Duell-Modus wird der Drache von einem Spieler gesteuert, während die Helden im Abenteuer-Modus das Abenteuer „Feuertränen“ spielen und sich dem Riesenlindwurm gemeinsam
stellen können. Durch eine Auswahl aus sechs verschiedenen Köpfen und vier Altersstufen bleibt der Kampf gegen den Drachen über viele Spiele fordernd und abwechslungsreich.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: War on the High Seas (2nd Edition)
Description:
The game is set in a time that world trade is plagued by piracy, dangerous ocean voyages and fierce wars. Can you a small time merchant battle the stormy oceans and avoid the scourge of piracy trading goods for profit and becoming a Master Merchant, or will you build a superior fleet of ships and become to become a recognised Admiral of the Seas or perhaps you will find wealth in war and plunder your riches conquering ports around the world and become a Lord Governor.

The game is played over a number of rounds until one player scores one of the three victory conditions and is declared the winner.

In the standard game players are aiming to excel at one of three objectives. Master Merchant, Lord of Maritime or Lord Governor. Master Merchant requires a player to have 150g and dock at a port owned by their nationality. Admiral of the Seas requires a player to have 3 ship cards in his fleet and capture or buy a forth. Lord Governor requires a player to place his last nations port marker on the board.

For a more challenging and longer game the number of objectives a player needs to win can be raised to 2 or all 3.

Once a player has met an objective their turn immediately ends, however the round is not over and continues giving other player the opportunity to complete an objective. At the end of the round if more than one player has managed to complete all objectives needed to win, victory points are awarded (see below) to decide a winner, the highest scorer ultimately wins the game, if in the rare circumstances there is a draw, they can decide to accept a draw or both fleets can combat until one side loses a ship giving victory to the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Gunsmoke Card Game
Description:
The object of Gunsmoke Card Game is to build a gang of Gunfighters and then shoot it out to the death. Players control a gang made up of Gunfighters Cards, they move around town earning dollars and buying weapons and items for their Gunfighters to improve their abilities in the hope they can defeat the other Gunfighters in Brawls or Shoot-Outs. When a player loses their last Gunfighter they have been defeated and are out of the game, the last player left is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Shadowfist: A Better Tomorrow
Description:
Expansion set for the Shadowfist card game.

In the newly reopened Future juncture, explore a world centuries after the Chi Bombs dropped.

In a scene straight from Planet of the Apes, the Simian Nation is a land where sentient Apes and Monkeys rule. Human beings are subjugated or collaborators in this Banana Republic.

In another part of the world, human-kind has re-established itself and through their stewardship, the Earth's chi has started to heal.

Between these conflicting empires rests a wasteland filled with a blend of bandits, outcasts, and operatives. It is within the wastes that the new portals open allowing Portal Crawlers from each faction to gain a foothold as they try to build...

A Better Tomorrow

—description from the publisher

Name: Charades: Kid Edition
Description: Contains 50 double-sided cards and an instruction sheet to play Charades with kids.

Name: Twin Play Classics: Monopoly and Scrabble
Description:
"Two of the world's favorite family games, Monopoly and Scrabble, in an beautiful boxed set."

These board games were a combination of two popular classic games contained in a premium wooden box, with the idea that they would grace a coffee table.   The boards of each paired game were on each other's flip side.  The case came with a brass plate and was sometimes called The Collector's Edition.   It was marketed as a game that would be "a great gift" or "part of your family's collection".

Name: Zone Stalker
Description:
A card game for 2-4+ players based on the Novella “Roadside Picnic” by the Strugatsky brothers.  Each player is a Stalker, venturing into the dangerous Visitation Zones to bring back valuable artefacts left by visiting Aliens.

There are 3 Decks: 
-  The Stalker Deck.  This deck is composed of cards the Stalkers use to avoid 
Hazards and find Artefacts. Each card has a Rating in 2 Traits: Avoidance Rating (used to avoid hazards) and Detection Rating (used to find artefacts)
-  The Zone Deck.  This deck has 4 card types: Location, Hazard, Artefact and Events.
-  The Character Deck. These represent Stalkers. Each one has a special Ability.

Players take turns with each turn having four phases:

1.  Stalker Phase
The current Stalker fills his hand to 10 stalker cards drawn from the top of the stalker deck.

2.  Zone Phase
A player may decide to completely skip the Zone Phase on his turn. 
The current stalker flips over the top card of the Zone Deck and places it face-up in the middle of the table. This card is called the Primary Zone Card. 
-   If the Primary Zone card is a location the Stalker must discard a stalker card of his choice from his hand along with the location card. 
-   If the Primary Zone card is a hazard the Stalker must play (discard) a stalker card to avoid it. The Hazard card will have a danger rating. The Stalker must roll 1D10 and add the avoidance rating on the Stalker card he played to the roll. If this total is equal to or greater than the danger rating of the Hazard card he successfully avoids it. If the total is less, he must roll 1D10 on the Hazard Table. Either way discard the hazard card. 
-   If the Primary Zone card is an Artefact the Stalker must play (discard) a Stalker card to find it. The Stalker must roll 1D10 and add the detection rating on the Stalker card he played to the roll. If this total is 7 or greater he successfully finds it. The stalker places it face-down next to him in his Swag pile. If the total is less, he does not find it; discard the Artefact card. 
-   If the Primary Zone card is an Event card, resolve it and discard it. 
-   The Stalker may repeat this process as long as he still has Stalker cards in his hand.

3.  Recovery Phase
If the Stalker skipped the Zone Phase completely, he may remove one injury marker. If he has 1 or more bracelets in his swag remove 1 additional injury marker.

4.  End Phase
The player may discard none, some, or all of his Stalker cards. Players may trade Stalker and Swag cards.

The game ends when only 1 player is left alive or a new turn starts and there are no cards left in the Zone Deck. The winner is the last Stalker left alive or the one with the most Swag Points at the end of the game.

Name: Kings of War 2nd Edition: Edge of the Abyss – Summer Campaign Book
Description:
Edge of the Abyss is a global campaign that will see the map of Mantica change, depending upon whether good or evil triumphs on the battlefield. Throughout the summer of 2017 we will be collecting the results from battles around the world, which means that you can decide the fate of Mantica. You’ll also find brand new heroes, new units, formations and more to bring your games of Kings of War to life.

New Heroes

Rules and background for 14 new Living Legends from factions all over Mantica, from Artakl the Gekkotah Clutch Warden to Dravek, the Abyssal Dwarf Iron Caster, these heroes can be included in your forces during the campaign.

New Formations

Combine certain units in battle for a bonus on the tabletop. These formations were created by the Kings of War Rules Committee and are built upon the existing background for each race.

New Scenarios

Fight in different battlefields across Mantica, from the Elven Twilight Glades to the Edge of the the Abyss itself! These specialised scenarios set the stage for the most pivotal battles of the campaign.

New World

You can record your results during the campaign through Beasts of War . Based on those results, the world of Mantica will change!

—description from the publisher

Name: Four Against the Abyss: A Supplement for Four Against Darkness
Description:
When standard dungeons do not pose much of a challenge anymore, your experienced heroes may want to go deeper, looking for greater rewards. Once all of your characters reach 5th level, you will want to start using this book!

This is an expansion to Four Against Darkness designed for character levels 5 to 9. It includes;


     using a d8 for combat and saves
     new monster reactions
     new, more powerful monsters
     expert skills that your characters can learn
     new spells for wizards and elves
     rules for madness, disease, vampirism and lycanthropy
     details of hirelings and professionals your party can hire
     plots for campaigns
     updates to all charts, including new monsters, encounters, special events, and treasure


Take your party into the Abyss and step into the tier of experienced adventurers!

Name: A Word or 2
Description:
A word or 2 is a board game based on the T.V. game show of the same name. It aired in South Africa from 1998 - 2008. It was adapted from Des chiffres et des lettres.

The object of the game is to be the player with the highest number of points after nine rounds: six word games, two number games, and one conundrum.

Playing the game

The Word Game
Vowel and consonant cards are shuffled separately and placed face down in two piles. Taking turns, players 'call' either "consonant" or "vowel". A card from the corresponding pile is placed on the playing mat until all nine spaces have been filled. Players then attempt to form words using the letters before the timer runs out, with no letter being used more than once. The player with the longest word gets a point for each letter in the word, or 18 points if all the letters were used.

The Number Game
A randomiser is used to generate a number between 0 and 999. Players take turns calling for "high" or "low" value cards until Any or all of the selected number cards can be used to reach the target number, but numbers can only be used once. Permitted calculations are addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
When the timer runs out, players announce their numbers. The player with the number closest to the target is awarded points as follows (provided the calculations were correct):
10 points for reaching the target, 7 points if within 5 (inclusive), 5 points if within 10 (inclusive), 0 if beyond 10.

The Conundrum round
A list of 275 jumbled up nine-letter words are provided in the rule sheet. The first person to guess the anagram scores 10 points.

Winning
The contestant with the most points at the end of all nine rounds is the winner.

Name: Quatro Flash
Description:
There are games that make you wonder why nobody has come up with the idea before. The family game Quatro Flash is one of these.

The game rules are pretty simple, and the objective of "four in a row" sounds very familiar. There are actually a great many two-player games based on this principle. As a family game, though, this idea is amazingly new, suspenseful, and witty.

Players proceed in turn. Each player places a disk of their color on the board. The object of the game is to arrange four of your disks in an uninterrupted row, whether horizontally, vertically or diagonally. They can be lined up on the same level, stacked on top of one another, or staggered as a stair-cased row.

You need to follow the course of the game very attentively if you are to spot early enough a player's potential chances of winning and try to prevent this with one of your pieces.

The temptation is great to disclose a player's possible chances and urge the other players to intervene, but this is not allowed. Creative conversation, however, cannot be prohibited completely.

Name: Fladder flats
Description:
Everybody is enjoying a fun day at the beach but those pesky seagulls are about to ruin the day.

In Fladder flats you play the seagull, you spin a spinner and it shows you target color, you skweez the seagulls tail and try to hit the target sunbather with soapy poop. Every player has a 4 member family of a certain color. The last sunbather without poo determins the winner.

Name: Way of the Fighter: Brahm vs Cobalt Fighter Pack
Description:
Way of the Fighter - Fighter Packs are small packs of cards introducing two new fighters to the game, along with two new techniques for the existing styles.

Brahm is a brutal Scandinavian metal-head, with an in-your-face aggressive nature. His deck can consist of three technique from the Hard style, and his ability allows him to suffer 1 damage in order to give his attacks Chain 1. Brahm is able to turn the Hard style in a combo heavy fighting form, at a cost. His mode action, Ragnar-Rock, makes it so that opponents no longer cancel his actions when he is damaged, but the tradeoff is that it prevents him from blocking. Brahm’s Valhalla Block allows him to recover health that he may have willing suffered for those high damage combos. Health management is a key feature to Brahm playstyle.

Cobalt, an Argentinian and elite ex-commando for the Red Star Committee, has a cybernetic arm that she uses to reposition and strike at her opponents from both near and far. This is represented best with blast actions that only last until the end of the challenge phase. For example when Dragging Hook’s blast token hits a retreating opponent, Cobalt pulls the the opponent towards her space. Grappling Thrust on the other hand, will pull Cobalt closer to the opponent when they are hit by its blast token.

The Brahm vs Cobalt fighter pack also comes with two sets of actions from the Push technique and Slam technique. The Push technique from the Hard style provides powerful attacks that push their target away, making it ideal for fighters wishing to distance themselves from an aggressive opponent. The Slam technique is one of the most physical sets of actions from the Fluid style that uses momentum to control the opponent’s position in the arena.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pizza World
Description:
Players are master pizza makers looking for the finest ingredients in a market. Each player is given shopping lists of ingredients to collect. With a limited number of ingredients in the market, getting the ingredients you need may not be easy.

Pizza World is a game about completing as many personal and shared shopping lists as possible, optional 'take that' elements and remembering where you last saw an ingredient - although they might not be where you thought.

Make friends, or not, as you compete for the ingredients you need.

—description from the designer

Name: Volt Egyszer Egy lakoma
Description: Roll and move game where players try to be the first to reach the end of the path by overcoming written movement instructions on each space.

Name: Plac
Description: Players roll and move around a path on the board to be the first to reach the end.

Name: Running Man: The Home Game
Description:
A board game based on the 1987 Science Fiction movie. One player is the Runners. The other is the Stalkers.
 The board is an 8x8 grid known as the Game Zone.  There are 4 main locations located in the corners: Runner Entry, Stalker Entry, Satellite Uplink and Rebel Hideout. The centre 4 squares are known as the Intersection. In order to go from any corner location to any other corner location, you must first enter an intersection space.

There are 4 Runners: Ben Richards, William Laughlin, Harold Weiss and Amber Mendez. There are 5 Stalkers: Subzero, Buzzsaw, Dynamo, Fireball and Captain Freedom. Characters have 2, 3, 4 or 5 hits. When a character takes damage a damage counter is placed on it. If a character has more damage counters than hits, it is killed.

Runners and Stalkers start the game at differing stages:

      At the start of the game the Richards, Laughlin, and Weiss counters are placed on the Runner entry square. Subzero starts on the Stalker entry point. Mendez enters the game on turn 4. 
     If Subzero is killed, both Dynamo and Buzzsaw immediately enter the game zone otherwise Dynamo and Buzzsaw enter on turn 6.
     If both Dynamo and Buzzsaw are killed, Fireball immediately enters, otherwise Fireball enters on turn 10. 
     If Fireball is killed, Captain Freedom immediately enters play, otherwise Captain Freedom enters on turn 14. 


Each player has a unique deck of cards comprising, Move, Attack, Defence and Special cards.  Players take turns to draw three cards, place them in their hand and then play cards to move their own units and attack opposing units. 

     Move cards are used (discarded) to manoeuvre a player’s units around the board.  A unit may make a max of 2 moves in a turn and must move the entire distance described by the move card or not at all.  
     Attack cards are used to make attacks against opposing units in the same space. A unit may make up to 2 attacks in a turn. 
     Defence cards are played to negate an attack.


The game ends when all Stalkers are killed or all Runners are either killed or escaped. 

     The Stalkers win if all of the Runners are killed. 
     The Runners get a minor victory if 1 or more of them make it to the Rebel Hideout. 
     The runners get a major victory if 1 or more of them makes it first to the Satellite Uplink and then the Hideout. 


—user summary

Name: The Postman
Description:
A board game based on the 1997 Science Fiction movie The Postman. One player is the Postmen. The other player is the Holnists.

The map shows about 40 owns linked by roads and includes other features such as rivers, forests, and mountains. The distance between two adjacent towns linked by a road is called a space. Towns have a rating of either small, medium, or large (which affects recruit rolls).

There are a variety of different types of units each of which have four differing statistics:

     Move - the maximum number of spaces the unit can move in a turn. 
     Fight - when rolling the D6 to attack, a roll of this number or higher will kill an enemy unit in the same town. 
     Sneak – a unit may attempt to move through a stack of enemy units. To do this, it must roll this number or higher on a D6. This stat is also used to retreat from an enemy that enters a unit’s location. 
     Recruit - when rolling the D6 to recruit, a roll of this number or higher will convert a militia in the town into one of the player’s unit types. 


A regular 52 card deck is used. The Postmen can use red cards. The Holnists can use black cards. Cards are played to influence dice rolls and statistics or to generate special events.

Players take turns with the The Postmen going first. Each turn is divided up into five phases:


     Move Phase
          Units can move a number of spaces up to their move stat rating and may attempt to move through a stack of enemy units by rolling their sneak number or higher on a D6. 
    
     Fight Phase
          If opposing units are in the same town, they will fight. All units get to make one attack and all attacks are simultaneous. 
    
     Recruit Phase
         Each unit may make 1 recruit roll if it occupies a town with 1 or more militia in order to convert 1 militia in the town into one of its unit types. 
    
     Militia Phase
         If a town is unoccupied by Postman or Holnist Units roll 1D6 to see whether a militia unit appears. 
    
     Mail Phase
         Draw 2 cards. Max hand size is 7 cards. Discard excess cards. 
    


The aim of the game is to destroy the opposing Leader Unit.

Name: Preppers
Description:
A card game for 2-4+ players in which each player represents a separate group of Preppers who are preparing for the end of the world. Players accumulate supplies and advantages in several different categories.  While this goes on players eliminate different end of the world scenarios until only one remains. The remaining scenario will favour certain types of stockpile categories which will determine victory conditions.

There are 2 common decks: 

     Stockpile Deck: This deck contains 10 cards in each of 13 different stockpile categories: Weapons, Food, Animals, Vehicles, Plants, Knowledge, Medicine, Shelter, Trade, Water, Power, Cold and Equipment. Each category of cards has two cards each of values 3 to 7.
     Scenario Deck: The scenario deck contains 20 cards giving a description of the stockpile categories advantageous in overcoming it (e.g. Zombie Apocalypse = Weapons x3, Vehicles x3)


To start flip over all the scenario cards face up and spread them over the centre of the table so that all of them are visible.  The top 5 cards of the stockpile deck are also flipped.

There are 3 stages: 

     Prepping Stage: Players take turns with to flip over the top card of the stockpile deck and take 1 of the face-up stockpile cards and put it face-down in their stockpile. Players can look at their own stockpile cards but not their opponents. Move to Scenario Stage if there are no more face-up stockpile cards. 
     Scenario Stage: Players take turns to pick one of the face-up scenario cards and put it face-down in a discard pile. When there is only one scenario left, it becomes the End of the World Scenario (EOTWS) and play continues to the scoring stage. 
     Scoring Stage: The EOTWS will list categories that receive a bonus card value multiplier. For example: if it is the Zombie Apocalypse, all your Weapons cards and Vehicle cards are worth 3 times as much.  For every category you have zero cards in, get -5 points. Your final score is equal to the total point value of all your stockpile cards. 


The player with the highest score at the end of the game wins.

Name: The Glorious South
Description:
The Glorious South is designed around a famous painting of Taiwan from the 1930s called "Festival on South Street". In the game, players describe different details in the painting, guiding their teammates to the answers and collecting different products in order to earn ingots and score. The products are all import and export goods for which Taiwan was famous.

Kuo Hsueh-Hu (1908-2012), one of the most well-known and respected artists of the Taiwanese art history, painted this painting in the 1930s. It was about "DaDaoCheng", an area in Taiwan which was not only the business center of Taipei in the 1920s and 1930s, but is also now one of the most cultural tourist site with beautifully renovated architectures and shops, cafes and galleries. The painting is now one of the most important art pieces of Taiwan and in the collection of Taipei Fine Arts Museum.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bunny Farm
Description:
Left from Albuquerque, past the Toad Empire, and far past McGregor's farm lies the small, fertile, and (mostly) peaceful land of Bunnitopia, which is home to the four great bunny families: Ice Cream, Chocolate, Macaroon, and Biscuit.

Harvesting carrots is serious business in Bunny Farm, and the four families are willing to do whatever it takes to build the largest and most successful farm in the land. Build factories, expand your farm, sabotage crops, or even manipulate the markets in your favor. However, you'd better build some fences before the dreaded GIANT BUNNY comes and eats ALL your crops. Spring is almost here. Better get harvesting soon!

Bunny business is brutal!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zombie Doctor: The Zombie Card Game
Description:
Zombie Doctor is a fun and frantic card-turning game. Amputate, reattach and swap limbs in a desperate bid to stay alive. It's your turn not to turn!

The game is designed for 2-4 players (preferably 4), lasts for around 60 minutes and is suitable for ages 15+, due to the comic zombie gore.

It's small enough to fit in your pocket and is suitable to play at parties or if you have a spare hour with friends and family.

The game is easy to learn but the elements of luck and strategy will keep avid board gamers entertained and challenged.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sum On
Description:
Sum On is an abstract strategy game of clever move chaining, for two players. You must use both your pieces and your opponent’s pieces to make bonus moves, so step wisely!

Your pieces are numbered 1–8. On your turn, you move one of your pieces one step orthogonally or diagonally forward. Then, look for a bonus move: Choose an axis through that piece, and sum the values of all pieces along that axis (including the one you moved, any of yours, and any of your opponent's!). Now you get to move your piece whose number matches that sum, and so on until you've run out of bonus moves. Finally, it's your opponent's turn.

The game ends when someone cannot make their opening move for the turn. Each player sums the values of their pieces that made it all the way to the other side; higher sum wins!

The rules also offer two variants, which means there are 4 ways to play the game!

—description from the publisher

Name: Fruit Ninja: Slice & Dice
Description:
Fruit Ninja: Slice & Dice is a strategic dice game for 2 to 4 players where each players are trying impress Sensei by slashing specific combos of Fruits.

Each round is splited in 2 phases:


     Rolling Phase: Simultaneously and in real-time, all players have 20 seconds to roll up to 3 times their dice.



     Buying Phase: In clock-wise order, starting from the first player, all players get a chance to spend their dice result on Combo Cards and claim one of the 6 Goal cards.


The game ends as soon as the Combo Deck runs out. The winner is the one with the most points!

—description from the publisher

A Kickstarter campaign was initiated for a series of 3 games based on the popular app game. Having not met the expected goals, the campaign was terminated. From the 3 games announced, only 1 made it to print: Fruit Ninja: Combo Party.

Name: Merlin: Queenie 1 – Treasures of the Environs
Description:
Mini-expansion for Merlin that was offered to backers during the Kickstarter-campaign and will be available for purchase at conventions where Queen Games has a presence.

It contains 15 new terrain tiles which replaces the terrain tiles without a tower on them. Every time a player builds a manor one of these tiles he can use a special action granted by the tile.

Name: Pioneers: Queenie 1 – New Frontiers
Description:
New Frontiers is a mini-expansion for Pioneers that contains three extra modules:

• New Hotel (module 1) consists of different tiles that replace those in the base game
• The Sergeant (module 2) gives every player a sergeant board, and the sergeant token replaces the immediate special action of the sergeant in the base game
• The Farmer (module 3) has a farmer token that replaces the immediate special action of the farmer in the base game

Name: Squeeze
Description:
All beginnings are difficult. Imagine you assemble a poor wooden self-made lemonade stand and work yourself up to a global juice producer. That's exactly what you do in Squeeze. In this two player card game you can either win if you max out one business niche (stuff, production, marketing) or if you prevent your opponent from doing this.
                                                                                           With Squeeze you get:
-Fast and arousing two player card game.
-Simple rules but you need a sharp eye to master it.
-A perfect lunch-break game, invites to an immediate revanche.
-Family friendly and easy to carry (small cardbox)

After every quarter of the year (quick card duels) you have the opportunity to get business cards from the market with which you upgrade your business. How many depends on how much more lemonade you sold this quarter than your opponent. A business unit which has the most upgrades in the game - and that's what makes the game interesting - gives you a certain advantage.

But pay attention, not every business card can immediately upgrade your company. If you still sell your lemonade for 50 cents in the neighborhood you probably will not need the lemon squeezer ultra 9000 yet. If there is nothing in your interest you can let yourself cash out and use the money on later markets. It is quite important to keep a close eye on what your opponent is doing because before you know it he "strikes" all your niches and wins the game. If the legal way doesn't work you can also get the black "illegal cards" from the market to gain mad advantages.

Squeeze is the kind of game you want to play in every lunch break. It takes around 10 minutes and invites to an immediate revanche. It is perfectly made for two players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Orléans: Neue Ortskarten N°5
Description: Orléans: Neue Ortskarten N°5 is a set of three new tiles for use in the Orléans base game or the deluxe edition of the game. The tiles feature a road, a ballroom, and a church.

Name: Tv-seriespelet
Description:
A Swedish quiz game about tv-series. Contains 500 questions in 5 different categories ("Nordic", "Drama/Comedy", "Fantasy/Sci-Fi", "Action/Crime" & "Oldies but Goldies").

The youngest player starts by choosing a category. The player to the left reads the question. You are allowed to continue until you choose the stop, your answer is wrong or all questions on the card have been answered. If you give a wrong answer you lose all the points you had collected during this turn.

The first player to reach 15 points is the winner!

—user summary

Name: Orléans: Promo Ortskarten N°1
Description: Orléans: Promo Ortskarten N°1 collects three tiles that can be used in the Orléans base game or deluxe edition that were previously released as promotional tiles for publication partners. These tiles are Orlean: Zagroda (Farm), the OrlÃ©ans: Prairie, and OrlÃ©ans: Christmas Market.

Name: Mission Impractical: 1st Promo Pack
Description: Mission Impractical: 1st Promo Pack is a mini-expansion for Mission Impractical that consists of 11 new tasks and 16 new items. Some of the cards contain slightly more mature content than those in the base game.

Name: Polemos
Description:
Polemos is a wargame played on a gridded map printed on cloth. Cardboard terrain is added to the map. Cardboard hills in different sizes are included in the game, placed under the cloth.

The game is deterministic with no randomness, but has some hidden information regarding how many more losses each enemy unit can take before it is eliminated.

The game was patented and published first in 1883, and sold as a package with the rulebook and pre-painted playing pieces for two generic unnamed armies. Each army is controlled by 1-3 players. The first two editions of the game used miniature soldiers. The third edition instead used painted blocks.

Name: Battle
Description:
The game was patented in 1908. "It is listed in the Gamages Christmas Bazaar Catalogue of 1913, where it is priced at 2s 6d and described as an 'exciting war game, played by 2 or 4 persons by pieces representing Generals, Cavalry, Guns, Infantry and Ammunition, on a battlefield". (from C. G. Lewin, Wargames and Their History).

Battle is played on a regular 8x8 chess board. Pieces that are square tiles with symbols, letters, and digits on to describe the type, movement and attack patterns of each. When played with four players, the pieces on each side is divided between two players so that one commands the eight infantry units and the other player commands the remaining eight units.

Name: Batman Miniature Game (Second Edition): Core Rulebook
Description:
Citizens of Gotham, pay close attention! Things may never be the same again…
Since the release of the Batman Miniature Game five years ago, we’ve seen a lot of changes here at Knight Models. The games has gone from strength-to-strength, with a hardback core rulebook, two expansions, and the successful launch of the Batmatch organized play rules, helping to grow our amazing community around the world.
 We are delighted to announce the arrival of the 2nd Edition Batman Miniature Game rules. 
This free downloadable PDF rulebook is the culmination of thousands of games, and feedback from our customers. 
Fear not: it is still the game you know and love, with its street-level strategic action in Gotham’s darkened alleyways, but we’ve taken the opportunity to streamline the mechanics, making the rules more intuitive and even more fun, and we’ve consolidated a lot of hard-to- find rules and Traits into one mighty tome. We think players new and old will love it!
 But that’s not all – far from it! The launch of the new edition is spearheaded by brand new miniatures, representing the pinnacle of our studio’s output. The new models are produced in high-quality, coloured resin. Knight Models was founded on a love of display-quality models, and we think painters and modelers will agree that these new miniatures are the best we’ve ever produced.

The Batman Miniature Game is a skirmish game based on the broad Batman universe. You can command one of the most famous criminal bands in Gotham City to expand your territory and control the underworld, or stop their evil plans with the Dark Knight and his allies.

The game includes the most important characters created by Bob Kane, like Batman himself, Robin, Nightwing, etc. aided by the Gotham City Police trying to stop the gangs led by the most infamous criminals and psychopaths of the DC Comics universe, like The Joker, Penguin, Two-Face and many others.

Knight Models team has created incredibly detailed miniatures to accurately portray these characters and their sidekicks in 35mm scale ready to assemble and paint. This is a licensed and official DC Comics product.

Here are just a few changes to the game for the new 2nd Edition:
 Bat Cape (1SC, Passive)
As long as it is able to spend a Special Counter, the model will not take Damage, be Knocked Down, nor become a Casualty as a result of Falling or Jumping. In addition, the model may Leap Down without spending the MC, and without using any of its total movement allowance.
 Mixed Combat Style (2SC)
The model may perform a close combat attack action and a free ranged attack action in the same activation this round (no Action Counters are required for the ranged attack).

The actions Run and Spring into the Air are disappearing. This was a difficult decision, because we wanted to limit the number of Movement Actions 
and enhance the ones without changes, giving us a set of Movement Actions solid as concrete.
 We also bring forward changes that affect Speedsters.
In 2nd Edition, with the new changes shown on older teasers, we believe that more Speedsters will appear in the game board, and will have to manage their Speed Force Counters more accurately.
With this new rule, Action Counters will be determinant in their game:
 Fatigue
When a model with the Speedster trait has not any Action Counter, it suffers -1 to Movement and Defense Basic Skills.
 With all of this, we thought that Speed Force Master needed a little update:
 Speed Force Master
This model can spend up to 2 Speed Power Counters during the round like Action Counters.

These are just a few of the traits that have been improved for the 2nd edition.

Name: ¡Adivina!
Description:
Get ready for laughing afternoons where your family and friends will take on the most ridiculous identities and try to describe, interpret or draw them so that others can guess.
Players form groups. A player starts by choosing an easy or difficult card. He then draws a card from each different deck available, A, B and C showing it only to his teammate. Those cards have different identities in order 1, 2 and 3. The other team, without knowing and seeing the cards has to choose 3 numbers between 1 and 3, which will be the sequence of the identities that the previous team must try to describe.   
You then have to describe those identities to your teammate. If he correctly guess an easy identity he scores 1 points, and if he guess a difficult one he will score 3 points.   
The team who scores more points wins.

Name: Black Stories: Uni Edition
Description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with riddle stories with a university background.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

Name: Black Stories: Strange World Edition
Description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with strange riddle stories from all over the world.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.

Name: Miau Miau Katzenklau
Description: Miau Miau Katzenklau has both cats and witches in it in some combination.

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Silencer Expansion Pack
Description:
Engineered for speed and incredible handling, the TIE silencer is devastating in the hands of those who can unlock its full potential. Lesser pilots, however, are often overwhelmed and unable to maintain control of the nimble craft. Fortunately for the First Order, the TIE Silencer Expansion Pack for X-Wing pairs its sleek and menacing, pre-painted miniature starfighter with a quartet of talented pilots, including the dark side Force user Kylo Ren. Additionally, you’ll find twelve upgrade cards, one condition card, a maneuver dial, and all the plastic and tokens you need to launch this lethal fighter into action!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Big Horse Chess
Description:
According to The Classified Encyclopedia of Chess Variants (§33.4, p305), Big Horse Chess shares little in common with orthodox chess except that it's played on an 8x8 board with pieces that hop like chess knights.

A player scores a point whenever any four of their eight pieces form a square of any size. Pieces that are landed upon are removed from play. The game ends when one player is down to three pieces. Highest score wins.

Name: Sea of Nadia
Description:
Sea of Nadia is a board game about hunting treasures around the Sea of Nadia.

You will dive into a fantasy land of 17th century where treasures are all over the islands of the Sea of Nadia. And you will take a role of one of 4 captains - a rich but still crazy about gold merchant Sam Bellamy, a brave lady Charlotte de Berry famous for her unpredictability, strong and explosive pirate Bartholomew Roberts, and sneaky bastard brought up by pirates Jean-David Nau.

You will take control of a captain and travel on a ship around the map, collect resources, open chests full of treasures, gain captain powers, get best merchant offers, cooperate with others to stop the most rich ones or maybe trick other hunters by messing their plans or even steal their keys or treasures and many more!

To open chests you will need specific combinations of resources so the more luxurious is the chest - the more difficult it is to collect required keys and the more points you get.

To improve your abilities and get great one time deals, you will be able to buy cards which give you permanent or temporary effects.

But be careful and look at the compasses, as they will show you what is happening in the sea and will affect all of the players!

There's also a fun choice for the Admirals of each round, where they will roll dice and assign them to each captain including themselves!

If this sounds like something you're into, let's sail with us the SEA OF NADIA!

- description from the designer, Alex Maklai

Name: Hexus Plus
Description:
-Game introduction
Hexus is a game using cubes and puzzles. 
Players have to plan and use their own strategy through exchanging, acquiring cubes and holding each other in check.
This is a useful board game, which is easy to learn and enjoyable for everyone, as well as being helpful for brain health.

-Game objective
Each player has to move using a dice and construct a Hexus base while they compete with each other through exchanging, and acquiring cubes, that have various shapes and holding each other in check.
There are 2 ways to finish The Hexus game. At this time, the player who constructs the most stable and ideal Hexus build wins.

Name: Building Babel
Description:
It's a Thursday afternoon on the Plain of Shinar, and once again there is nothing to do. (History hasn't been invented yet much less bowling!) It looks like another wasted day. But then one of your buddies has a bright idea! "Let's build a tower all the way up to heaven!" he says. "Sure, I've got nothing better to do" you reply. And so the legend begins . . .

Building Babel is a card game for 3-6 players in which, working together, they try to successfully build the fabled Tower of Babel. In so doing players will also be trying to get more recognition for their efforts than the others do. Throughout the process God will be trying to stop them?

All that is required is 1 deck of playing cards and a handful of markers/tokens for each player. The cards are considered to be of two types – “Brick” cards (2 to J) which are used to construct the Tower, and “Act of God” cards (Q, K, A) which disrupt the construction process.

The deck is shuffled and a hand of cards dealt to each player (hand size is determined by the number of players). The rest of the cards form a draw pile.

Players take it in turns to play as follows:

     The active player plays a valid "Brick" Card on the Tower. These must be placed in order. The base of the tower is a row of four 2s. Next up will be the 3s and so on until the top row is filled with the Jacks. There must always be at least two more cards on any uncompleted level below the one being played to. If a player completes a row in the tower, they place one of their tokens beside it. This will show who put the most effort into the project, come the end of the game!
     If they cannot play a "Brick" card the active player must play an “Act of God” card (if they have one).  The effect of the cards are as follows:
         ACES: The next player misses their turn.
         QUEEN: The order of game play is reversed (e.g. from left to right.)
         KING: The last “Brick” Card played is taken off the tower and is shuffled into the draw pile.  Additionally when the first King card is played all game related talking between players must stop due to confusion of the languages.  When the fourth King card is played the game is over! 
    
     When the player has played their card (Brick or Act of God) they pick up the top card of the draw pile, their turn is over and play passes to the next player.
     If they have no “Brick” or “Act of God" card to play the player must pass their turn. If the player was forced to pass their turn they cannot draw a card. On the turn after a player has passed, they may choose to shuffle up to half of their cards (round down) into the draw pile and replace them with an equal number then drawn from the top of the deck. That player's turn is then over.


Play continues until the tower is completed or the fourth King appears at which point God stops the project.  In the event that tower is finished all players win, but the player with the most tokens beside the Tower is the big winner!  However, if the fourth King card is played before this happens then everyone loses but the player with the most tokens beside the tower is the biggest loser for have put so much effort into a failed project.

Name: Findefuchs
Description:
Felix Finderfox and his friends are playing hide and seek! But who is hiding behind which bush? The friends can be found by using strong memory skills and by having a little good luck. Players earn valuable shamrocks along the way; the goal is to be the first to win three shamrocks!

... a wild, push your luck memory game

—description from the publisher

How to play:


     Roll the die. 
     Move Felix Finderfox toward the end bush by as many bushes as there are dots on the dice.
     Felix Finderfox stops next to a bush.
     Guess who is hiding behind the bush.

Name: BRAINBO!
Description:
Players race to get rid of all their seven cards by matching them with the card uppermost on the discard pile. There are no turns, so players have to keep their eyes open and brains switched on.

The game's matching mechanics are based upon the Stroop effect. Two different modes mean that things are never simple and the matching method can reverse at any given moment; colour>word or word>colour.

Punishments for incorrect matches and two different types of special cards spice things up a bit.

—description of the designer

Name: Heroes & Commanders
Description:
A World War II tactical game based on the mechanics of Colonial Space Wars.

The first prototype recreates small battles between Germans and Americans in the western front of Europe. It uses a hexagonal board with round tiles for units, while cards are used for controlling health, ammo and fuel supplies during the game.

Name: Honoris Beer
Description:
HONORIS BEER (ENGLISH RULEBOOK)

COMPONENTS:

- 40 characters of beer cards.
