- 1 yellow opaque dice with 20 sides.

- 4 wood player tokens.

- 7 title tokens of "Honoris Beer".

- 1 initial player token.

- 20 beer glasses resources.

- 10 beer barrel resources.

INTRODUCTION:

Honoris Beer is a fun game of chance and resources, with some strategy, where players will have to try to win challenges of greater stamina by drinking beer before other opponents or challengers and thus be able to win the honorary title "HONORIS BEER", or great brewer.


OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME:

Be the first to get 2 honorary tokens "Honoris Beer". For this you will have to be lucky in the rolls of the die and choose well in each play who is difficult to obtain and possession of resources so that he does not get these title cards.

PREPARATION OF THE DEPARTURE:

1. Each player chooses a color (purple, orange, yellow or brown) and places his card in his table area.

2. The deck of the 40 character cards is shuffled and placed face down in the center of the table.

3. Also next to the deck will be the resources of beer glasses and the resources of barrels, as well as the yellow die of twenty faces with numbering from 1 to 20 and the title chips "Honoris Beer".


HONORIS BEER (REGLAMENTO ESPAÑOL)

COMPONENTES:

-    40 cartas de personajes cerveceros.

-    1 dado opaco amarillo de 20 caras.

-    4 fichas de madera de jugador.

-    7 fichas de título “Honoris Beer”.

-    1 ficha de jugador inicial.

-    20 figuritas de recurso de vaso de cerveza.

-    10 figuritas de recurso de barril de cerveza.

INTRODUCCIÓN:

Honoris Beer es un divertido juego de azar y de recursos, con algo de estrategia, donde los jugadores tendrán que intentar ganar retos de mayor aguante bebiendo cerveza ante otros contrincantes o retadores y poder así ganar el título honorífico “HONORIS BEER”, el o la gran cervecero/a.


OBJETIVO DEL JUEGO:

Ser el primero en conseguir 2 fichas de título honorífico “Honoris Beer”. Para ello habrá que tener suerte en las tiradas del dado y elegir bien en cada jugada a quién se le dificulta la obtención y posesión de recursos para que no consiga estas fichas de título.

PREPARACIÓN DE LA PARTIDA:

1.    Cada jugador elige un color (morado, naranja, amarillo o marrón) y coloca su ficha en su zona de mesa.

2.    Se baraja el mazo de las 40 cartas de personajes y se coloca bocabajo en el centro de la mesa.

3.    También junto al mazo se colocarán los recursos de vasos de cerveza y los recursos de barriles, así como el dado amarillo de veinte caras con numeración del 1 al 20 y las fichas de título “Honoris Beer”.

Name: Elder Sign: Omens of the Pharaoh
Description:
An eternal tyrant struggles to return to life from beneath the scorching sands of Egypt in Omens of the Pharaoh, the newest expansion for Elder Sign, a cooperative dice game that takes a team of investigators into the dark corners of H.P. Lovecraft's terrifying mythos. Based on the Dark Pharaoh expansion for the Elder Sign: Omens app, a team of investigators must travel to Cairo and join an expedition to stop the rise of the Dark Pharaoh Nephren-Ka. This dread ruler seeks to return from beyond the grave and continue his blood-soaked reign of terror. What otherworldly forces have preserved Nephren-Ka for all this time, and how can such a being be stopped?

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Omen
Description:
Omen is a 2-4 players game with an approximate duration of 30-45 minutes. The players represent powerful gods confronted between them to get success in their own divine plans.
In the game, each player has some power tokens that allow them to influence the state of the board that represents humanity, divided by its different alignments: goodness, neutrality and evil.
In order to get the control of the areas of its interest, players will have awesome cards that can play to take advantage and decide the human fate.

In Omen you'll find a simple game with amazing mechanics and interactions, easy to learn, with a lot of strategy but very little chance.

Players must guess their opponents' intentions in order to anticipate them, carefully calculate each of their decisions, and forge strange alliances if they want to rise among the others with more influence points to become the most powerful of the gods.

—description from the designer

Name: BrainBox: Mr. Men Little Miss
Description:
The object of the game is to win as many cards as possible in ten minutes. The first player takes a card from the Brainbox and turns the timer over. The player then has ten seconds to study the picture on the card. When the timer runs out the card is passed to player two and player one rolls the die to see which question is to be asked. The questions are on the reverse of the picture card. Player Two checks the answer by looking at the picture and if it is correct the card is given back to Player One to keep. If the answer is wrong the card is placed back into the Brainbox and the next player chooses a card. Please remember, the answer to the question is on the picture side of the card, so look carefully! The player with the most cards after ten minutes wins! If there is a tie, it's sudden death with both players choosing a card and having to answer all eight questions on the card. The player who answers the most correctly wins! For 1 player Look at the card as above for ten seconds. Then turn the card over and answer all the questions (use a pen and paper to record the answers). If all questions are answered correctly the card is kept. If any answers are incorrect, the card has to be put back in the Brainbox. See how many cards you have after five or ten minutes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Pallid Mask: Mythos Pack
Description:
From the streets of Paris to the city's subterranean catacombs, your pursuit of the truth behind The King in Yellow leads you farther and farther from Arkham's familiar landmarks. But the streets, the language, and the eerie, dark tunnels aren't the only foreign elements at play. There's something distinctly otherworldly in the Parisian catacombs…

In The Pallid Mask scenario, you and your fellow investigators will enter these tunnels in search of a stranger whom you believe must be connected to the events surrounding the performance of The King in Yellow at the Ward Theatre in Arkham. But with each new strange twist and turn, you'll find yourselves only stepping deeper into mystery. Perhaps you can follow the tunnels all the way to the pulsing heart of the play's mysteries, but there's a chance, too, you'll simply find yourselves lost amid the shifting landscape. What begins as a trek through moist and clammy tunnels of stone may become a journey that leads you under the earth, through The Gate to Hell, and straight to your demise at the Well of Souls or some other forgotten chamber.

Destined to be a fan-favorite, the scenario from The Pallid Mask utilizes the game's locations in a novel way, bringing them into play only as you travel through them, and arranging them in a constantly shifting and unpredictable fashion. Each new step through these labyrinths could be your last.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Path to Carcosa
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Cetro
Description:
The players have to get their 14 playing pieces (crowns and bishop's miters) from their starting position to the starting position of their opponent.
Forward movement is by jumping diagonaly over friendly or opponent playing pieces. The pieces may move diagonaly backwards to get in position for other pieces to jump over them.
The playing pieces can't move onto the white spaces.

Name: Fantasy-Opoly
Description:
Escape from Reality with Fantasy-Opoly
Summon a Fellowship and March to Quest!
Who hasn't dreamed of being a legendary hero? Of being sent on a magical quest to save a princess, fight a dragon, or find the long lost treasure? Prepare to brave the battlegrounds of light and dark!

Collect your favorite mythical creatures and amass a fortune by trading Runestones in for Keys to the Keep. It’s all fun and games until you wake the dragon and you’re sent to the Dungeon for three turns!

Who knows? You may soon be knighted by the King… or eaten by trolls! Whatever happens, this is a game where you are the hero,and the fate of the earth rests in your hands.

On a player's turn they move their token around the board and purchase properties. When they land on other player's own property they have to pay rent.

Once a player can not pay another player due to being out of funds or property, they are out of the game. The object of the game is to be the last player standing with properties and currency.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: The Iridescent Wyvern
Description:
This additional drink card came as a promo in the deluxe edition of The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport.

Drink Effect: +3 Alcohol. Reveal the top 3 cards of your Character Deck, then draw those cards.

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Firewater of the Fire Mage
Description:
This additional drink card came as a reward in the deluxe edition of The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport.

Drink Effect: Gain 2 Alcohol. Draw 2 cards from your Character Deck, then discard 2 cards from your hand. You may not take any game actions between drawing and discarding.

Name: The Impregnable Fortress
Description:
A World War 2-themed board game centered around the Battle of Singapore in January 1942. Two players struggle for dominance on a hex-grid map encompassing Singapore and Southern Johore, with one player controlling the invading Japanese forces under General Yamashita, and the other controlling the defending Commonwealth forces under General Percival.

Players can play using four levels of difficulty, using various optional rules and add-on cards for greater strategic depth and challenge. The game features thirty historically accurate incidents or individuals related to this battle, and players will be able to make use of tanks, artillery, aircraft, anti-tank guns, combat engineers, mines, and recon troopers in the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Minato Jung
Description:
Although trained in the ways of the Samurai, Minato was always destined to follow his own unique path. A brute of a man, more at home in a water house than the courts. His body tells the stories of countless battles, wearing each scar proudly as a mark of honour to his physical prowess. That is not to say that he is all brawn, a cunning and clever leader, hiding from the Prefecture in plain sight. In battle he wields his trademark anchor, launching it through the air making it appear as light as a Tengu feather. Those unlucky enough to be caught by his attentions sent sprawling, dazed and disorientated.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Yuji
Description:
All captains must have a trusted Juhin and there is none more trusted, in any port in the Gulf of the Three Brothers, than Yuji. A seasoned sailor and servant of the Jung, for many cycles he has barked the orders of his captains, the Kaizoku darting to complete his commands, an inspiration to them. Never far is his oldest friend Same, no one is able to catch Yuji napping with the old monkey around.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Tetsuso
Description:
There comes a time after many cycles when a Korusea has spent so long living a life on the waves that he starts to become more comfortable on the gentle rocking of a ship than the solid earth of land. Tetsuso has been touched by the Kami of the sea and turned into a monster of shell and claw, a formidable adversary capable of snapping bone and steel alike.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Korusea
Description:
The Korusea make up the bulk of the veteran seaman of the Jung, skilled sailors and warriors, armed with wicked curved blades which gut a man as easily as a fish. Their secondary weapon is a web woven from light but very strong twine, used to subdue an enemy up close or at range.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Asami, Sea Witch
Description:
She is a daughter of the waves, a sister to the sea. She speaks with mists of the waters, able to command their presence to confuse and daze. Her siren sound is music and death knell to all but the most hardy and resolute. In battle she calls forth water for the environment to wash away toxins, extinguish flame, calm the mind or as a hammer to batter foes. She brings great flexibility just like the water from which she was born.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Duri
Description:
He is almost as good a shot as he boasts and with his two “ladies” by his side, a threat to even the most nimble monk or heavily armour samurai, making him a legend amongst the Jung. The tale of how he lost his leg a source of much amusement amongst his peers.
—description from the publisher

Name: Mars Open: Subscriber promo
Description:
This promo card for Mars Open was mailed to subscribers of the Bellwether Games newsletter.

Its an unfolded "ball" card.

Card back has the normal game markings but says "Subscriber".

From the card:

"Instructions -

1. Fold each corner on the dotted line as indicated. (Adjacent corners will be folded opposite directions.)
2. Rotate the "ball" so the open side faces you.
3. Flick away!!"

Name: Bushido: Ryota
Description:
Ryota is the perfect pirate. He is a shock troop of unparalleled ability, his transformation into a Great White has only added to his impact. Years spent leading the charge whether it be onto naval vessels or merchant junks has refined Ryota’s skills into a well honed tool that the Jung prize highly. Once he has charged through the defense’s of his enemies he has the energy to hold the ground until his allies catch up.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Yori, The Whale Hunter
Description:
The legend of Yori is known across the Jung, spread mainly by the man himself. When deep in his cups he will tell any that will stop to listen to him, boasts from catching whales of unfathomable size to wild and fantastical sea creatures. The truth is Yori is no better with the harpoon than anyone else, however he has learnt to be resourceful in battle. He always has sake on hand and uses it to bolster his own and others' confidence when combat ensues.
—description from the publisher

Name: Bushido: Jung Pirates Special Card Pack 1
Description:
Special cards are an interesting and flexible way to create a very focussed, individual and distinct Warband for your favourite faction. There are four types of Special Cards and each work slightly differently but each in their own way enables you to customise your Warbands to fit the play style or theme you want.

These packs contain an assortment of Enhancement, Event, Terrain and Theme Special cards that range from martial techniques to ancient shrines, acts of amazing heroism to soul draining terror. Each pack contains thematically fitting cards to adhere to the faction’s strengths, weaknesses and in game feel.   
—description from the publisher
